author: Daniel Kruger
title: U.S. Government Bonds Edge Higher in Volatile Market Session
text:
U.S. government bonds fluctuated Tuesday as a wave of volatility swept through financial markets, highlighting the competing pressures affecting bond prices in recent weeks.
The yield on the benchmark 10-year U.S. Treasury note settled at 2.766%, down from 2.791% at its 3 p.m. close on Monday. The 10-year yield dropped as low as 2.648% in the overnight session, according to Tradeweb, before rising and falling as stocks swung between gains and losses, remaining volatile in after-hours trading.
